data.title: Yasunari Kawabata✖ Yukio Mishima
data.meta_description: This is a transcript of a conversation between Yasunari Kawabata and Yukio Mishima moderated by Tadashi Itoh, a literary critic, after Kawabata was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1968. Itoh: Here we are…
data.text:
This is a transcript of a conversation between Yasunari Kawabata and Yukio Mishima moderated by Tadashi Itoh, a literary critic, after Kawabata was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1968.

Itoh: Congratulations.

Mishima: Congratulations.

Kawabata: Thanks.

Itoh: Here we are in the garden of Mr. Kawabata’s house in Hase, Kamakura… Mr. Kawabata, who doesn’t appear on TV very often, has come to talk to us specially because of his congratulations. We feel that this is the joy of the nation, the joy of our literary circles as a whole, and the joy of Mr. Kawabata. Mishima and I would like to talk to you while reminiscing about various things and expressing our feelings… Are you tired from last night?

Kawabata: Well, I didn’t sleep much at home, so… but, well, I’m fine.
